results.title: Understanding Shakespeare: his stagecraft
results.creator_credit: Gateway Educational Films, Murtin Productions and W. Hugh Baddeley
results.brief_description: Designed to show that the physical properties of the Elizabethan theatre materially affected the work of Elizabethan dramatists. Illustrates the features of the 16th century theatres. Extracts from Shakespeare’s plays are performed on a reconstruction of the stage of the Glove Theatre, showing the use of dramatic techniques.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gateway Educational Films, Murtin Productions and W. Hugh Baddeley

results.title: Understanding Shakespeare: his sources
results.creator_credit: George Murcell, Gateway Educational Films and W. Hugh Baddeley
results.brief_description: Designed to show how Shakespeare’s plays grew out of many elements available to him, elements that he fused together and developed in an unparalleled way. Shows the background of Elizabethan London. Includes extracts from Julius Caesar, Henry V, A Midsummer Night’s Dream and Hamlet, performed by members of St George’s Elizabethan Theatre Company.

results.title: Understanding sexuality (with booklet)
results.brief_description: An educational video with accompanying booklet featuring Professor Derek Llewellyn-Jones, professor of obstetrics and gynaecology at the University of Sydney discussing subjects such as sexuality, puberty, menstruation, sexual behaviour, contraception, pregnancy and abortion, sexual diseases and sexual responsibility with a group of adolescents.

results.title: Understanding ourselves: human heredity
results.brief_description: Illustrates the basic concepts of heredity in an easily understandable context. The mechanism whereby human characteristics are passed from generation to generation is discussed. The function of chromosomes, genes, and DNA in the heredity pattern is explained. Also considers the influence of temperament, behaviour and mutation.

results.title: Understanding our universe
results.brief_description: Discusses how man has learned about the universe from ancient times until the present days as well. Discusses some of our growing knowledge of the universe - the solar system, Milky Way, and countless other galaxies and nebulae that extend millions of light years into space.

results.title: Understanding movies
results.brief_description: Presents a study of motion picture technique through excerpts from the MGM films: Tennessee Johnson, The Good Earth, Treasure Island, David Copperfield and, Romeo and Juliet. Highlights directing, acting, photography and editing as well as art and music. All excerpts from pictures produced and copyrighted by Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer.

results.brief_description: Places mathematics across the curriculum. Emphasises the need for children to experience activity based programs so they can become confident in using mathematical concepts and vocabulary.

results.title: Understanding individuals (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
This episode emphasises the importance for managers to develop an interest in understanding some of the characteristics of their most important resource - the organisation’s members. Understanding the needs, values, attitudes and perceptions of individuals helps managers make better decisions about selection, placement and training. The Sheraton Towers Hotel and Metropolitan Fire Brigade are two organisations profiled here and a test case of the attitude survey conducted at Dulux is also featured.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Understanding Herbal Medicine
results.brief_description: This program is a practical guide to basic herbal medicine. Common herbs are listed and their therapeutic qualities are described. An informative guide to alternative remedies for everyday health problems.
